criteria: Comprehensiveness of the plan to avoid HIV, AIDS, other STDs, and pregnancy.
Accuracy and currency of information presented in the plan.
Feasibility and practicality of the plan in real-life scenarios.
descriptions: The plan is missing or does not address key elements for prevention.
The plan includes some elements of prevention but lacks depth and detail.
The plan addresses most elements of prevention but may have minor gaps in information.
The plan is comprehensive and addresses all key elements of prevention with adequate detail.
The plan is very thorough, well-explained, and includes additional resources or strategies.
The plan is exceptionally detailed, demonstrates a deep understanding of prevention methods, and is tailored to specific scenarios or individual needs.
The plan contains inaccurate or outdated information regarding prevention methods.
The plan includes some accurate information but also contains inaccuracies or outdated details.
The plan is mostly accurate but may have minor errors or lack the most current information.
The plan presents accurate and up-to-date information regarding prevention methods.
The plan demonstrates a strong understanding of current guidelines and recommendations for prevention.
The plan reflects expert-level knowledge of the most current research and best practices in prevention.
The plan is unrealistic or impractical for implementation in real-life situations.
The plan includes some feasible elements but may not be practical in certain scenarios.
The plan is mostly feasible but may require adjustments for specific situations or individuals.
The plan is practical and can be realistically implemented in various real-life scenarios.
The plan is highly adaptable and provides contingency plans for overcoming potential barriers.
The plan is exceptionally well-suited for individual needs and circumstances, demonstrating a deep understanding of practical challenges and solutions.
